column1: Trypsinogen is a substance that is normally produced in the pancreas and released into the small intestine.
A test can be done to measure the amount of trypsinogen in your blood.
This test is done to detect diseases of the pancreas.

Increased levels of trypsinogen may be due to: - Abnormal production of pancreatic enzymes - Acute pancreatitis - Cystic fibrosis - Pancreatic cancer Low or normal levels may be seen in chronic pancreatitis.
